str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb, doko dok'-o of the same meaning; to think; by implication, to seem.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and deiknuo; to show off, i.e. Exhibit; figuratively, to demonstrate, i.e. Accredit.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
From apostello; a delegate; specially, an ambassador of the Gospel; officially a commissioner of Christ.

word: at the end [ of the procession ],
str2: Last, at the last, finally, till the end. A superlative probably from echo; farthest, final.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
At the point of death, condemned to death. From epi and thanatos; doomed to death.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 1st Person Plural
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
From theaomai; a place for public show, i.e. General audience-room; by implication, a show itself.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably from the base of komizo; orderly arrangement, i.e. Decoration; by implication, the world (morally).
From aggello; a messenger; especially an 'angel'; by implication, a pastor.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
